survey.definition: Factors relating to an individual's diagnosis and health status that may impact on trajectory management.
questions: How certain is the individual's diagnosis?
Does the individual have more than one health condition?
If the individual has more than one health condition, do they affect each other?
How stable is the individual's condition?
How familiar is the nursing staff with the individual's health needs?

survey.definition: Factors relating to an individual's care needs that may impact on trajectory management
questions: What is the extend of the individual's care needs?
What is the complexity of the individual's care needs?
How stable and predictable are the individual's care needs?
How familiar is the nursing staff in meeting the individual's care needs?

survey.definition: Factors relating to the health and social care team that may impact on trajectory management
questions: How many different health and social care providers are involved in the case?
Are the team familiar with each other?
How easy is it for all team members to communicate and share information and knowledge about the individual?
Is there agreement within the team about care and treatment plans?
Is there agreement between the individual/family and health/social care team about  care and treatment plans?
Is there a requirement for case conferences or dedicated multidisciplinary team meetings?

survey.definition: Factors relating to an individual's social circumstances that may impact on trajectory management
questions: Does the individual have the support of a family/social network?
Do the individual and family agree on their health and social care arrangements?
Does the individual's family/social network have implications for their health and social care arrangements?

survey.definition: Factors relating to an individual's psychological status that may impact on trajectory management
questions: Is the individual affected by the psychological impact of an illness or injury
Is the family affected by the psychological impact of the individual's illness or injury

survey.definition: Factors relating to an individual's cognitive status that ma impact on trajectory management
questions: Does the individual have problems with memory?
Does the individual have problems with thinking skills?
Does the individual have a learning disability?

survey.definition: Factors relating to the legal aspects of individual's care that may impact on trajectory management
questions: Are there safeguarding/guardianship issues involved in the case?
Are there issues relating to decision making and power of attorney in the case?

survey.definition: Factors relating to financial aspects of an individual's care that may impact on trajectory management
questions: Are there issues in relation to the funding of care arrangements

survey.definition: Factors relating to the organisation and maintenance of an individual's material resources (equipment and/or physical aides) that may impact on trajectory management
questions: Does the individual require equipment and/or physical aides to support their health and social care needs?
Does the ward/unit have in place the equipment and aides requires
Are adaptations and/or modifications to the individual's home required
Are special arrangements required to support medications management
Is there a requirement for education and knowledge sharing with non-specialists care providers?
Is there a need for education and knowledge sharing with individuals and/or family

survey.definition: Factors relating to an individual's care and procedures/treatment interventions that impact on care trajectory management
questions: Is the individual scheduled to undergo any procedures: surgery, diagnostic tests, interventions?
How familiar is the nursing staff with the requirements for these procedures?

survey.definition: Factors relating to the information requirements of admission, discharge and transfers of care which may have an impact on trajectory management
questions: Has the individual been transferred from another department/ward/hospital?
Does the plan of care involve transfers of care?
Are the arrangements for discharge complex?

survey.definition: Decide for overall Tract Assessment for each patient
questions: Have you checked summary after you saved Assessment?
